Looks good. I miss the ability to rename terminal tabs which was removed in Ubuntu a while ago. The remote server management feature is also super helpful.

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because when you right click inside the terminal, 2 things happen: you can't click inside the terminal again to close the context menu; you have to press Esc or select something from the menu in order to close it. The other thing is that the terminal loses focus (not a major problem, but disturbing visually)
Best app for terminal use
Works on Ubuntu 20.04, Focal Fossa. Amazing terminal, highly recommend.
I've been using for 2 years and I just love this terminal.
Split screen, pretty, fast, what more can u ask for?
The terminal is quite great. It is very user-friendly.

cool themes, cool UI, nice settings. However there are two problems:
-once you right click, it is impossible to close the dialog unless you select an option, sometimes this is very annoying
-would be cool you could launch a command whent the terminal is opened.
fix those things an you will have by sure the best terminal app!

description: Glad to see that Chinese so-called 'independently-created' Linux distro begin to contribute to the open-source community.
Thanks for the awesomeness.
I had installed it solely for trying out the quake mode but it simply wouldn't turn on even after pressing alt + f2. I also can't find the setting to change the shortcut.

I have been using this app for the past year. Have not had any problems whatsoever. Unsure why some people are having problems. I have been using it with Ubuntu 20.04 and Pop!_OS 20.04. Perhaps people are having problems because they are using a different version of Ubuntu or there might be a kernel incompatibility.
